item.title: A Look Back With AYS
item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description: We are finally seeing a comeback in our industry and want to look back on the past year and a half and celebrate our successes. So proud of this team. #HospitalityIsHere

item.title: The Hospitality Buzz: Women In The Workplace Edition
item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
The Hospitality Buzz is BACK and our most recent episode features our own Jeanine Cosgrove-Albert speaking with four leaders in the hospitality and food service industry on the experience of women in the workplace both before and during the COVID-19 Pandemic. The panelists discuss the importance of supporting other women in the workplace while also acknowledging the unfair factors that contribute to some women’s inability to advance their careers regardless of such support. Drawing from their personal experiences at Pepsico, Ecolab, GrubHub and Zee the Cook, our panel’s reflection on what it means to be a women in leadership throughout both their careers and in the pandemic specifically was eye opening and a must watch.

Follow Us To Find Out When The Buzz is Live

Check out each of our panelists below and make sure you’re following us on social media so you can see clips from the latest episode in the coming weeks and stay tuned for the full episode to be posted soon!

Sumi DeBenedittis: Director of Food Service Development and Communications at PepsiCo Sumi has been part of PepsiCo’s Foodservice division for 20 years. She is currently part of the National Foodservice sales team managing sales and industry communications, activities that promote and enhance the most important topics for our customers and efforts to elevate our Foodservice associates and partners.

Sumi came to PepsiCo in 2001, after spending four years in advertising at Saatchi & Saatchi and Wrenchead.com. Her roles at PepsiCo have included Customer Marketing, Industry Relations, Sales Chief of Staff, Equipment Innovation and Foodservice Communications. She is also President of Valor, PepsiCo’s employee resource group for the veteran community and Business Development lead for PAN, PepsiCo’s group for Asian employees.

Sumi has served in a variety of roles with our key industry partners. She is currently the Diversity & Inclusion Council Chair for the Society for Hospitality & Foodservice Management (SHFM) and previously served on its Board of Directors, as National Conference Chair and Marketing Committee Chair. She has also volunteered for committees with the Women’s Foodservice Forum (WFF), the Multicultural Foodservice & Hospitality Alliance (MFHA) and the International Foodservice Manufacturers Association (IFMA). Among the recognitions she has received are two PepsiCo Chairman’s Awards for Pepsi Spire and Hello Goodness Vending, the SHFM Spirit Award, SHFM’s Robert Pacifico Leadership Award, the SHFM Leadership Award, and Total Foodservice’s Top Women in Metro New York for Foodservice & Hospitality.

Sumi grew up in Cambridge, Massachusetts and graduated from Bryn Mawr College with an AB in Growth & Structure of Cities and has an MA from New York University in Studio Arts/Photography. She lives in Brooklyn with her husband Mike and six-year old twins, Max & Luca.

Barbara Kane: Former Vice President of Industry Relations at Ecolab Barbara Kane recently retired as the Vice President of Industry Relations for Ecolab Inc., the world’s leading provider of cleaning, food safety and health protection products and services.

Barbara Kane has over 35 years of experience in the hospitality industry. Most recently she held the position on Vice President Industry Relations at Ecolab, where she represented Ecolab cross divisionally with all trade associations in the areas of foodservice, hospitality, healthcare, government, education, and manufacturing. Previously she held the role of AVP Global Accounts at Ecolab and was a corporate account manager with Sara Lee Coffee and Tea.

Kane serves on many Industry Association Board of Directors, and also serves on advisory boards for University of Nevada Las Vegas and San Diego State University. Kane frequently keynotes to Associations and Corporations on topics ranging from food safety to women in business.

Kane graduated with honors and received a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from University of Arizona. She currently resides in the New York City area.

Zee Shami: Culinarian and Owner of Zee the Cook Zee Shami is the Owner of ZeeTheCook Culinary Studio in Metro Detroit, a school offering cooking and baking instruction to kids, teens and adults. Zee and her team host in-person and virtual Corporate Team-Building Workshops, Private Cooking Parties, and other Recreational Life-Skills Services.

ZeeTheCook is also a licensed Vocational School in the State of Michigan offering Certifications in Hospitality Management, Culinary Fundamentals, and NRF Customer Service + Sales. Zee is nationally recognized as a Rising Star through the Society for Hospitality and Foodservice Management and the proud recipient of the 2020 Director's Award for Community Service, as well as the recipient of the Woman in Business Award (Henry Ford College) and Start up Business/Entrepreneur of The Year Award through the Dearborn Chamber of Commerce.

Shayla Martin: Senior Sales Executive with GrubHub Shayla is a Sr. Sales Executive at GrubHub on their Campus Team. She attended Auburn University and received her Bachelor of Art in Psychology. In 2011 she received her MBA in Sustainability from Valparaiso University. Shayla is a breast cancer survivor and the journey taught her all the life lessons we’ve all heard about. This led her to join the Leadership Council for The Pink Agenda, a Breast Cancer Research Foundation organization dedicated to raising money for research. Life has taken her to many cities, but she calls New York City home.

The Buzz is a video and podcast thought leadership series. Follow the podcast below to get notified when the full episode releases and make sure to keep up with us on social media for exclusive clips leading up to release day!

Follow The Buzz On Apple Follow The Buzz On Spotify

item.title: The Hospitality Buzz: Higher Ed Edition
item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
Students are eager to return to normal life on campus, but what does normal look like in 2021? With all we've experienced during the pandemic, will all the trappings of traditional campus life ever return at all or will the student and administrative experience be forever shaped by what we learned in 2020? We sat down with professionals from NYU, MIT and Harvard Law School to discuss what's next for higher-ed food service and hospitality.

Follow Us On LinkedIn Keep Up With The Buzz

Check out each of our panelists below and make sure you’re following us on social media so you can see clips from the latest episode in the coming weeks and stay tuned for the full episode to be posted soon!


Sunita Devi, Director of the Kimmel Center for University Life at NYU
Lauren N. Williams, General Manager at Harvard Law School
Brian Rice, General Manager at Samberg Conference Center – MIT Get Notified When The Buzz Is Live

item.title: The Hospitality Buzz Is Back!
item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
The Hospitality Buzz is BACK! With vaccines expected to be ready by year’s end, all eyes are on mid-2021 for a return to normalcy. But coming out of a global pandemic, what does normal look like and how are hospitality and food service managers preparing for it? We invited four young professionals from Compass Group, Nestlé USA and Aramark/Lifeworks to get together and answer these questions for us!

Check out each of our panelists below and make sure you’re following us on social media so you can see clips from the latest episode in the coming weeks and stay tuned for the full episode to be posted after Thanksgiving!

Follow Us On LinkedIn!

Justin Drew, Previously Served As Director, Business Development for Compass Group (top left): Justin brings over 12 years of experience in Business Development, Operations, and Sales Leadership within Contract Management for Corporations, Healthcare and Higher Education industries. Exceptionally talented, firm, fair, with a laser focus on customer experience, growth and retention, Justin is an expert at producing strong results for clients and providing the best overall solution. Most recently Justin served as North America Director, Business Development for Compass Group’s Unidine Sector. Justin currently sits on the Board of Directors as President for the FBI Philadelphia Citizens Academy Alumni Association which is a Community Outreach program and ambassador leadership program to support local field offices. Justin is a second year rising star within SHFM (Society for Hospitality and Food Management), he is the co-chair for the Philadelphia local committee and is on the 2020 conference planning committee. Justin enjoys networking and cultivating meaningful relationships and you will always see him with a big smile on this face.

Jenna Calhoun, National Account Manager at Nestlé (top right): Jenna is a creative, enthusiastic, driven sales leader with 12+ years of experience in CPG and beverage industries with some of the biggest brands in the world. Now a National Account Manager at Nestlé, Jenna began her career in retail and more recently, foodservice, leading national accounts, recreation, and workplace. She is passionate about relationships, strategy, business development, leadership, and networking. A Strong communicator, story-teller, and organizationally savvy, Jenna is Chicago and Northern California raised. She currently resides in Richmond, VA. A University of California grad, Davis (go Aggies), Jenna is results focused and competitive, with a personal commitment to continuous self-improvement and the bettering of others.

Brisbane Vaillancourt, Vice President Operations at LifeWorks Restaurant Group (bottom left): Brisbane Vaillancourt is the Vice President of Operations with Lifeworks Restaurant Group, a premium brand within Aramark. She has an extensive background in operations, training, openings, marketing, change management, growth and innovation. Brisbane has proven herself to be a forward thinking innovator who implements structures and processes to secure long term prosperity. Brisbane began her hospitality career with Margaritas Management Group, a privately owned, twenty-eight unit restaurant chain for twelve years. In 2016, Brisbane began working with Aramark as a District Manager, leading ten corporate dining clients and $38M annualized revenue. In 2018, Brisbane was the recipient of the Aramark Star of Excellence Award and is now a three-year recipient of the SHFM Rising Star award (2018-2021). In February 2019, she was promoted to Vice President of Operations for Lifeworks Restaurant Group.

Katie DeSimone, National Director of Catering and Conference Services, Compass Group, Bank of America (bottom right): Originally from Newtown Connecticut, Katie studied culinary arts at Newtown High School, achieved an Associates in Baking & Pastry and a Bachelor’s Degree in Food Service Management from Johnson and Wales University in Rhode Island. Her career with Compass Group started in 2010. She spent time working her way up in corporate catering positions before becoming the National Director of Catering & Customer Experience. Katie spent almost 6 years traveling the country every week, working with different teams, guests and clients before settling into her role as National Director, Catering & Conference Services with Compass Group at Bank of America.

Get Notified When The Buzz Is Live

Overheard On The Buzz

item.title: We're Here To Help With On-Site Covid Testing!
item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
Let Us Organize Your COVID-19 Testing!

We are here for you. At Your Service Staffing can provide full service on-site COVID-19 testing programs for your team. Our team of medical professionals and collectors will arrive at your location with required PPE and testing materials to administer individual specimen collection for COVID-19 testing. Our team will handle the entire process - from scheduling for tests to collection, test administration and reporting. Most test results are returned within 48 hours and can be shared with administrators via comprehensive reporting upon test taker approval.

Learn More About Our Covid-19 Testing & Protocol

item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
The Hospitality Buzz is BACK!

The Hospitality Buzz is BACK and hosted by Jeanine Cosgrove-Albert, Vice President of At Your Service Staffing! This candid conversation is filled with hot takes from foodservice & hospitality experts, thought leaders & influencers. Topics range from real-time responses to COVID19 pandemic setbacks, to take this time to test new technology like, mobile ordering and apps for use when employees return to work. The panelists share best practices and the importance of leaning into networks like SHFM for support & guidance. We are proud to be part of this industry and we will get through this together.

Meet The Buzz Line-Up of Leading Hospitality and Foodservice Experts & Influencers:

  • Mark Freeman, Global Strategic Manager for Foodservice, Ford Motor Company

  • Damian Monticello Sr. Manager, Corporate Hospitality Services, GuideWell

  • Robert Gordon, VP of Workplace Services, American Express

  • Sharon Eliatamby, Sr. Program Manager, Food & Conference Services, World Bank Group

  • Jeanine Cosgrove-Albert, Vice President, At Your Service Staffing

A special thanks to the entire team for participating in this important conversation. Each person contributed insightful perspectives and the dialog was full of hope for the next steps forward.

Check Out the Full Episode of The Buzz NOW!

Want to see more? Check out our YouTube channel for more insights & quotes from key industry experts & thought leaders.

item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
AYS Spotlight Series: Sunita Devi, Director, Kimmel Center, New York University

Jeanine Cosgrove-Albert, Vice President, At Your Service Staffing, had the pleasure to sit down with higher education event leader & PR expert, Sunita Devi, Director, Kimmel Center, New York University. Sunita Devi brings years of experience and expertise to this candid conversation and graciously shared her thoughts on important COVID-19 event related issues like:

  • The commitment NYU has made to COVID-19 protocols & the impact it will have on the daily lives of students and faculty on campus.

  • The changes being made to events procedures & campus event spaces as students return this fall.

  • A glimpse into the behind-the-scenes logistics & planning for scheduled events in fall 2020.

  • The importance of connection, leveraging relationships and tapping into industry networks like, the Society of Foodservice and Hospitality Management (SHFM), to help weather the constant changes in the event industry and learn how to best use this time to be strategic in planning the future.

  • The impact that those who are still employed can make in the name of those who have lost their jobs due to the impact of COVID-19.

Watch Full Interview NOW with NYU’s event expert Sunita Devi!

Want to see more? Check out our YouTube channel for more insights & quotes from our Interview with NYU event expert, Sunita Devi.

View Key Insights from Sunita Devi, higher Education Event Expert

Do you have a story to tell or industry thought leadership advice to give? Reach out for the chance to sit down with our team for a featured interview today!

item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
I Have a Service Heart

Snapshots of our AYS team & their commitment to staying safe by wearing masks & gloves and following our new safety COVID-19 protocols.

The AYS Team is Staying Safe & Getting Back To Work with Service Hearts!

To answer the call of our industry, At Your Service Staffing has added dedicated and reliable back-of-the-house & healthcare foodservice staffing divisions to our already robust hospitality services team. Our unwavering commitment to exceeding expectations is summed up by an overarching belief that “Attitude is Everything" and having a SERVICE HEART is at the core of our entire team and everything we do. 

As our teams in New York and Long Island get back to work during these uncertain times, we took a moment to spotlight & survey some leading AYS staff members. We asked about their experiences providing services to our valued clients during COVID-19 and what they do to make themselves & guests feel safe and comfortable while performing their jobs. 

We are so proud of our AYS family and the core belief that having a SERVICE HEART sets our team apart from the rest. We all fundamentally believe that compassion can only be truly understood when it is practiced and we are committed to doing our part to take action, stay informed, and make change happen.

Check Out Insights From Our Service Heart Q&A with AYS Team:

Q: Since COVID-19 started, how has your job changed? 

A: Since COVID-19 started, all necessary precautions were instituted at the catering sites. We were asked to wear masks, gloves and to keep our distance from each other. 

Q: During COVID-19, what have you done to feel safe & comfortable while performing your job?

A: It feels necessary to always go to the job site well before the "call time." For me, that means arriving 1/2 hour to 1 hour prior to the call time. This helps me to understand the lay of the grounds, see where I'll be working, watch other staff go about their jobs and really understand what the client is going to expect of me.

Q: During COVID-19, what have you done to help others feel safe & comfortable while performing your job? 

A: Can you see me smiling? Sticking out my tongue? No?! Ahhhh, the mask. LOL!!!  So, I wave, give a thumbs up, do a little happy dance, introduce myself to other staff members (from a safe distance), and try to be as helpful and accommodating as I can while I do my job. Also, I find that acknowledging people and asking them if they are "ok" and saying " how are you"  are good cheerful conversation starters that help set the tone for a great shift prior to guest arrival. 

We are so proud of our AYS family and the core belief that having a service heart sets our team apart from the rest. We all fundamentally believe that compassion can only be truly understood when it is practiced and we are committed to doing our part to take action, stay informed, and make change happen.

Check out some our past AYS Service Heart Spotlight Interviews:

Meet Karen Meet Juan Meet Jamie

Learn more about how At Your Service Staffing has answered the call of our industry and added dedicated and reliable back-of-the-house & healthcare food service staffing divisions to our team.

Contact Us To Learn More

item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
AYS Virtual Summer Series: Victoria Vega, SVP, Business Excellence, Unidine

At Your Service Staffing Vice President, Jeanine Cosgrove-Albert, had the pleasure to sit down with foodservice pioneer Victoria Vega, SVP, Business Excellence, Unidine. Vega brings over 30 years of innovative foodservice & culinary expertise to this conversation and shared her thoughts on leadership during the COVID-19 crisis, the impact felt by her team and adaptations Unidine, a premium healthcare foodservice provider, has made to continue to support clients during the pandemic.

Traceability Is Key To The "New Now"

Episode 1: Victoria Vega, SVP, Business Excellence, Unidine, shares key insights with Jeanine Cosgrove-Albert about the impact COVID-19 will have on the future of the hospitality industry. In episode 1, she focuses in on how traceability in the supply chain will be key as the food service industry adjusts to the “new now”



Leadership in The Virtual World

Episode 2: Victoria Vega, SVP, Business Excellence, Unidine, shares key insights with Jeanine Cosgrove-Albert about the impact COVID-19 will have on the future of the hospitality industry. In episode 2, she focuses on how leaders are responsible for making sure all voices are heard in this new virtual world.

Want to see more? Check out our YouTube channel for more insights from key industry experts & thought leaders

AYS Thought Leadership Series

Do you have a story to tell or industry thought leadership advice to give? Reach out for the chance to sit down with our team for a featured interview today!

item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description: We are excited to announce that we are sponsoring the Phin Food and Shelter Project. This was created as an urgent, non-profit initiative by Phin to make an immediate impact for Foodand Shelter causes affected by COVID-19. 100% of the sponsorship proceeds will be sent directly to a curated list of high impact organization. AYS has funded a $10 donation credit to help attendees get involved!
item.content:encoded:
Register Now For Our Annual Cystic Fibrosis 5K Race to Benefit Team Boomer & The Boomer Esiason Foundation!

Looking for something active, fun and charitable to do on Saturday and Sunday, July 11th & 12th?

Then we’d like to invite you to register to run in our annual cystic fibrosis virtual 5K waffle race, which will also include a costume contest competition this year! 

BONUS: Your registration fee will go to help, support & benefit Team Boomer & The Boomer Esiason Foundation — all while getting active & staying safe!





RACE INFORMATION & REGISTRATION LINK

WHAT IS THIS EVENT: At Your Service Staffing presents our Annual Cystic Fibrosis Virtual 5K Waffle Run, including costume contest competition! Our race is part of the Sayville Summer Series, which is a three event virtual race for 2020 and will benefit Team Boomer & The Boomer Esiason Foundation.

WHEN & WHERE: Saturday and Sunday, July 11 & 12th, 2020 - this is a virtual race. (see more detail below)

REGISTRATION INFORMATION: Registration Cost is $60 (see link & what is included below). The registration fee allows runners to participate all three virtual races taking place this summer for one special rate.

PRIZES, GIVEAWAYS & SWAG:


T-Shirts:

  • Every participant will receive one tech fabric or cotton race t-shirt (participant's choice) for the entire series. 

  • The shirt will be delivered to participants approximately three weeks after the first event.

Raffle:

  • Each participant will automatically be entered into our raffle.

Awards:

  • "Best Run Costume" as voted on by race participants $50 Gift cards to Sayville Running Company will be presented to the winners of 5 year age groups.

  • Fun prizes including gift cards to local Sayville restaurants and businesses will be awarded to the 3 winners of our thematic awards, which will be different for each race.

  • Awards and raffle winners will be announced by the race directors from each of the series races.

Scoring:

  • Race results will be collected after each event via a form emailed to all participants.  

  • Entrants will be on the honor system for submitting their own results.

  • Results will be posted after each race and emailed to participants.

  • Series winners will be determined by adding up the cumulative time of all 3 races, with the fastest times winning each 5 year age group.

  • Results for the first 2 races must be submitted by 11:59pm on the Sunday of the weekend the races take place.  

  • Results for the final race must be submitted by 3pm on Sunday, August 9th so we have time to prepare results for the online awards party

Virtual Post-Race Party & Live Music:

  • A post race awards ceremony and celebration will be live streamed via Facebook Live and Instagram Live.

  • ﻿Live music from local musicians will be included in our post race celebration.  Be on the lookout for announcements about which musicians will be playing.

For more information & to register visit: 

LINK TO Register View Race Website

Permalink

item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
AYS Client Spotlight Series: Shelley Dickinson, Service Director, CxRA

At Your Service Staffing Vice President, Jeanine Cosgrove-Albert, sat down with Shelley Dickinson, Service Director of CxRA to discuss the COVID-19 pandemic, the future of the hospitality industry, how hospitality professionals should prepare for the re-opening, what advice she wishes she had given herself pre-covid and so much more.

Do you have a story to tell or industry thought leadership advice to give? Reach out for the chance to sit down with our team for a featured interview today!

TELL US YOUR STORY

item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
BLACK LIVES MATTER

Educate Yourself. This Doesn’t Go Away Once The Topic Isn’t Trending.

At Your Service Staffing was built on the idea of having a service heart. During troubling times, like we are all living through right now, our commitment to service remains the same and extends beyond our clients. Our mission has been and always will be for our teams to impart goodwill to others by providing support to our communities & important causes around us. When hiring, we seek candidates who value human rights, diversity and volunteerism as much as we do. As a company, we support a range of charitable organizations and always look for ways to give back through thoughtful actions & hands-on efforts that will enrich the lives of others. In short, we understand that compassion can only be truly understood when it is practiced. We are doing our part to take action. stay informed, and make change happen. We urge you to check out some of the ways to get involved below and take some time out to have a service heart and support those who need our help now!

We will continue to listen and work hard today & every day to understand what it is we do not understand. Black Lives Matter.

Make a Donation:

Official George Floyd Memorial Fund Ahmaud Marquez Arbery Memorial Fund Black Lives Matter Fund NAACP Fund Protester Bail Fund - By State

Get Involved & Sign A Petition:

Join Show Up For Racial Justice group George Floyd Petition- CHANGE.ORG ACLU

Text for Justice:

Text “JUSTICE” To 668366

Text “FLOYD” To 55156

Text “ENOUGH” To 55156

Do you have other ways to help? We want to hear from you, send us an email and we will advocate for your cause and add to our list above:

EMAIL AYS TEAM

item.title: AYS Service Heart Spotlights — Quarantine Edition:
item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
Our Talented AYS Team Members Are Doing Their Part & Staying Safe!

There is zero chance that COVID-19 could keep us from shouting out some of our leading AYS team members! For this edition of our Service Heart Spotlight, we surveyed three of our all-star staff members, Juan, Mary & Jordan and highlighted some feedback from the AYS leadership on the impact these three have on our teams and client events.

These AYS team players from Baltimore, Long Island and Boston, not only shared some key insights on how to provide the highest level of service to our valued clients, but they also shared photos of their commitment to wearing masks & gloves and following our new safety policies & CDC procedures.

“Juan Causey, is the face and anchor of the Baltimore team and provides top service, second to none. Juan was the first AYS hired employee on the Baltimore team and rises to every challenge set before him. He is a true mentor and excels at educating all staff. Juan has an eye for detail and makes sure that if something needs to gets done, it will get done correctly! Juan is one of our leading captain and beloved by many clients, he puts them at ease when they see he is working their event. Juan is one of the true backbones of the AYS family and his passion for providing amazing service truly makes our company shine. From high volume to refined elevated service, Juan is your guy.” — AYS BALTIMORE TEAM LEADER

“When you think of family and community, you think of Mary Fasano. As waiter on our Long Island team, Mary is the type of team player who makes you feel like an old friend. Mary’s unique mix of care, communication and hard work is what makes a difference to our Long Island clients.” — AYS LONG ISLAND TEAM LEADER

“Jordan Whitman is a stand out in Boston. He quickly made his way up from server to one of our most prized team leaders, who we trust with the biggest of events. The way he speaks to and about his fellow staff members is always respectful and kind. He is an effortless leader.”
Fun Fact About About Jordan: He was born with a service heart and his whole life has been about hospitality, because his parents actually met while catering! — AYS BOSTON TEAM LEADER

Check out some our past AYS Service Heart Spotlight Interviews Below:

Meet Karen Meet Oya Meet Jamie

item.title: Virtually Support the AYS Team By Putting Your Online Likes, Shares & Reviews To Work!
item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
Recently, we saw another version of the graphic above circulating on our social media channels, so, we decided to put our own AYS spin on it! The original post focused on “how to support a small business for free” and listed all the actions online communities could do to virtually support teams they care about — without paying a dime.

This got us thinking.

Over the last several weeks of quarantine, our industry, business and team has been directly impacted by the effects of COVID-19. Even our own AYS VP, Jeanine Cosgrove-Albert recently contributed her point of view for a DevMedia & Events blog post on how the pandemic has changed our industry and gave advice to safely navigate the path forward when events return.

During these uncertain times, we have leaned into our event & hospitality networks to find ways to learn, evolve, keep connected & stay safe. Our main takeaway is that NOW, more than ever, we have an amazing opportunity to interact & engage with our online community and set the course for what comes next.

This is where we need your help! 

Whether you are a loyal client, previous employee or hospitality industry professional with advice to give, AYS would love to hear from you! For us, there is nothing more important to our continued growth and success then client & employee reviews and testimonials. We take your feedback very seriously and we will continue to work very hard to ensure every event, no matter how big or small, is a success. We sincerely thank you for your virtual help to support the growth of our business! We’ve got this & we are stronger together!

Please provide invaluable feedback & reviews below:

Indeed review Facebook Review Glassdoor Review Email our team

Check out latest posts & follow AYS social media

item.content:encoded:
Be Our Virtual Guest at the “Local Vibes - Oysters & Chill” Event to Benefit Food & Shelters Affected by COVID-19

Looking for something fun & charitable to do Thursday, May 21st at 6:30 EST?

Then we’d like to invite you to be our virtual guest at the "Local Vibes - Oysters & Chill" event and learn how to make a great summer chili-tea cocktail from tea aficionado/mixologist, JJ Villani and master shucking the perfect oyster from “oyster educator”, Keenan Boyle (aka The Tall Muthashucka), all while listening to soulful guitar jams by the talented Cassandra House!

BONUS: You can also help to support a local charity of your choice (on our dime), while staying home + safe!






Event Information, RSVP & Donation Links

WHEN & WHERE: Thursday, May 21st at 6:30 EST, join via the link below and enjoy a "chill, virtual night out" with local friends for a good cause from the comfort of your home!

WHAT IS THIS EVENT: We have teamed up to sponsor this COVID-19 initiative by Phin Food and Shelter Project for this one-of-a-kind chill virtual event featuring local friends + artists that also helps to support and make an immediate impact for Food and Shelter causes. We have funded a $10 donation for each registered attendee and you get to choose the cause it goes to!

WHO CAN ATTEND: Anyone! RSVP with the link below to attend the virtual event. Once registered you can claim $10 (on us) to donate to the charity of your choice. We paid the bill, you choose the cause! 100% of the proceeds will be sent directly to a curated list of high impact organizations!

LINK TO RSVP

Join us Local Vibes - Oysters & Chill on Thursday, May 21st at 6:30 EST.

Link to donate

We’ve funded $10 donation credit for each of you to get involved! Click link above to make donation.

Check out more details on this event and follow @aysstaff on instagram

Permalink

item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description:
Resources for Hospitality Workers Affected By COVID-19 Pandemic- Part 2

Across the country, support is being established for those affected by the COVID-19 global pandemic. We previously compiled a number of national & local pandemic resources that can be reviewed here. Below are additional resources focused on food availability and mental health. We will continue to update this list as updates and new resources become available.

COVID-19 Support & Resources For All Locations:

  • Aid for hospitality workers

  • Meditation & Mindfullness

  • Heart.org: Free at home work out’s

  • Stopbreathethink.org: Free meditations

Local meal assistance programs are also available:

WASHINGTON, D.C.:

ACCESS TO D.C. MEALS

CHICAGO:

ACCESS TO CHICAGO MEALS

NEW YORK CITY:

ACCESS TO NYC MEALS

BOSTON & MW:

ACCESS TO BOSTON MEALS ACCESS TO WORCESTER MEALS

BALTIMORE:

ACCESS TO BALTIMORE MEALS

LONG ISLAND:

ACCESS TO LI MEALS LI FOOD LOCATOR

*Frequent information updates will be made to this list of links above and to our community as often as possible regarding new and relevant coronavirus resources.

GET IN TOUCH

Please contact us if you have any questions, comments, or COVID-19 resources to share.

item.title: Back of House Staff
item.dc:creator: Karen Craig
item.description: During these uncertain times, one thing is certain: we are in this together. AYS has expanded to include BOH offerings in order to keep our staff working and our clients supported. We are here to help. Contact us today.
